intro: Podospermum taraxacifolium, commonly known as the starleaf podo, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed and arranged in a whorl around the stem. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
